isis.stitle: FULL POWER HYDRAULIC ABS BRAKE SYSTEM - REMOVE AND INSTALL - WHEEL SPEED Sensor

warning.para: Block the wheels to prevent the vehicle from moving. When working under a raised vehicle, support the vehicle with safety stands. Do not work under a vehicle supported only by jacks. Jacks can slip and fall over. Failure to follow this warning could result in property damage, personal injury or death.

caution.para: Individuals without factory training are advised not to work on the Full Power Brakes system to replace or repair items.

This is a modern, complex system offering greater braking proficiency and features than previous systems. If the system sustains damage or a component malfunctions and items need to be replaced, users are strongly advised to contact the nearest International dealer for professional assistance and repair. However, if location and circumstances prevent consulting the dealer, and components are to be replaced, the prescribed procedure must be followed accurately.

Precharged HCU's and spare parts must be handled with the appropriate care and attention and should not be exposed to excessive vibration or impact, nor air being blown into the hydraulic ports prior to assembly to the vehicle.
Clean the area around the wheel sensor before performing service.

svcprocinfo.para: Refer to FIGURE 73 for component location information while performing the following procedures .

svcsubproc.title: Sensor Lube Specification
svcsubproc.para: Meritor WABCO specifications call for a sensor lubricant with the following characteristics:

Lube must be mineral oil-based and contain molydisulfide. It should have excellent anti-corrosion and adhesion characteristics and be capable of continuous function in a temperature range of -40° to 300°F (-40° to 150°C).

step1.para: Install wheel chocks and turn the key off.
If it is necessary to remove the tire to access the wheel speed sensor, place safety stands under the axle.
Disconnect the fasteners that hold the sensor cable to other components.
Disconnect the sensor cable from the chassis harness.
Clean the area around the sensor to prevent contamination when the sensor is removed.

caution.para: In the following step, do not pull on the sensor cable to remove the sensor.

step1.para: Using a twisting motion pull the sensor from the sensor bushing. Do not pull on the cable. If necessary, use a suitable lever to gently pry the sensor from the bushing.
Remove the sensor and cable from the vehicle.
Remove the sensor bushing.

caution.para: Overtightening the sensor cable tie wraps may damage the cables.

step1.para: Clean the area where the sensor is to be installed.
Lubricate the new sensor bushing with the Meritor WABCO - recommended lubricant.
Install the sensor bushing by pushing it into the wheel end bracket. Make sure the sensor bushing tabs are on the inboard side of the vehicle.
Apply Meritor WABCO - recommended grease to the wheel speed sensor.
Push the sensor completely into the bushing until it contacts the tooth ring. The sensor will self adjust when the vehicle is driven.
Connect the sensor cable to the chassis harness.
Fasten the sensor cable with tie straps every 12 inches. Do not overtighten the tie straps. Correctly bundle and store any excess cable in the sub-frame.
If tire was removed previously, reinstall tire and remove safety stands.
Connect the EZ-TECH ® to the diagnostic connector located under the center of the instrument panel. Refer to FIGURE 49 . Start the EZ-TECH ® and open the TOOLBOX™ program.

Using the EZ-TECH ® and the TOOLBOX™ program clear all brake system related inactive fault codes. (Codes may have been set while disconnecting and reconnecting power to the system.) If active fault codes are indicated, refer to Section 5, DIAGNOSTICS AND TROUBLESHOOTING
to make the necessary repairs .
Disconnect the EZ-TECH ® from the diagnostic connector.
Remove wheel chocks.
